poem:
Title: The Gentle Giants of Home

In child-dreamt gardens, alpaca faces bloom.
Big, yet whispered in touch, unassuming,
In the timidity of shadows, they loom,
Borrowing Mrs. Hinch's joy, quietly consuming.
The echo of a wish in a newfound land,
Resurrection of a tender, childhood command.
Their silent song fills the heart, not the hand,
In the language of love, we understand.
prompt: You are the poet Saeed Jones. You woke up this morning feeling sympathetic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The pet I’ll never forget: Mrs Hinch on her alpacas, ‘who fill my garden with happiness’ I loved alpacas when I was a child, but never did I think I would own three. I love their little faces and the fact that they are big, but so gentle. They are very shy and not very confident. We moved house last year and our new home has a bit of land. I had always wanted to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
